name: Guilin
title: Guilin - Traveling China like your home yard
overview: Guilin, whose name means 'Forest of Sweet Osmanthus,' has captivated travelers for over a thousand years with its otherworldly karst mountain scenery. Located in northeastern Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region along the banks of the Li River, this city of 5 million people sits amidst a landscape so dramatically beautiful that it appears almost surreal. The jagged limestone peaks that rise abruptly from the flat river valleys have inspired countless Chinese poets and painters, with the classic image of Guilin's mist-shrouded mountains gracing everything from traditional scroll paintings to modern currency. The relationship between Guilin and the Li River defines the city's identity. This 83-kilometer waterway, flowing south through the karst landscape to Yangshuo, offers what many consider the most beautiful river cruise in China. Traditional bamboo rafts and modern tourist boats glide past formations with evocative names like Elephant Trunk Hill, Folded Brocade Hill, and Nine Horse Fresco Hill, each representing millions of years of geological sculpting. The riverbanks are dotted with traditional villages where farmers tend rice paddies and water buffalo wallow in mud, preserving a way of life that has changed little over centuries. Beyond its natural wonders, Guilin offers rich cultural experiences. The city has been a regional center since the Qin Dynasty over 2,000 years ago, serving as a strategic military outpost and cultural crossroads. The Reed Flute Cave, adorned with stalactites and stalagmites illuminated in rainbow colors, contains inscriptions dating back to the Tang Dynasty. Guilin's cuisine reflects its Guangxi location, featuring rice noodles that are famous throughout China, along with unique local specialties like oil tea and beer fish. Whether you're cruising the Li River at sunrise, cycling through the Yangshuo countryside, or simply watching the evening light fade over the karst peaks, Guilin offers a visual feast that lives up to its ancient reputation as the most beautiful place under heaven.

gettingThere: By Air: Guilin Liangjiang International Airport (KWL) with domestic and international flights
By Train: High-speed rail connects Guilin to major cities including Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou
By Bus: Long-distance bus services from neighboring provinces
gettingAround: Li River Cruise: Scenic boat tours between Guilin and Yangshuo
Bus: Public transportation to major attractions
Bicycle: Popular for exploring Yangshuo countryside
